user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_from_buffer:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_buffer (size_t size,
                                 void *buffer,
                                 enum MHD_ResponseMemoryMode mode)
{
  if (MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_FREE == mode)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                                   buffer,
                                                                   &free,
                                                                   buffer);
  if (MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_COPY == mode)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy (size,
                                                 buffer);

  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                                 buffer,
                                                                 NULL,
                                                                 NULL);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the provided function body and found no uses of memcmp (or other C standard library string comparison functions such as strcmp/strncmp) and no operations that compare or manipulate null‑terminated strings. The code only dispatches to other response-creation routines and passes a free callback; it does not perform any string comparisons itself. Therefore there are no fragments in this snippet that could violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 (which forbids using memcmp to compare null-terminated strings). If memcmp usages exist, they would need to be in the target helper functions invoked here (MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls or MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy) or elsewhere in the codebase — those were not included in this fragment and thus are outside the scope of this analysis.
